qas.question: Where did the Empress Dowager spend most of her time?
What was the murders of the missionaries called?

context: From 1889, when Guangxu began to rule in his own right, to 1898, the Empress Dowager lived in semi-retirement, spending the majority of the year at the <a0_0>Summer Palace<a0_0/>. On <a1_0>November 1, 1897,<a1_0/> two German Roman Catholic missionaries were murdered in the southern part of <a2_0>Shandong Province<a2_0/> (the <a3_0>Juye Incident<a3_0/>). In response, Germany used the murders as a pretext for a naval occupation of Jiaozhou Bay. The occupation prompted a "scramble for concessions" in 1898, which included the German lease of Jiazhou Bay, the Russian acquisition of Liaodong, and the British lease of the New Territories of Hong Kong.
